author: bridge-bot
content: <iamchaals> Agreed - and the absence of tests seems like correspondingly under-engineering. (Testing is hard, and making tests is really hard work, but it leads pretty quickly to better quality specs and implementations when done thoughtfully) (re @rjected: Machine readable specs, to me, seems like overengineering in the existence of tests. The main goal of a spec is to be unambiguous (in words) and allow the reader to very easily understand how to create an implementation that matches the spec.)
